meanings.definition: A feeling of deep admiration for someone or something elicited by their abilities, qualities, or achievements.
meanings.sent1: She showed her respects by applauding loudly at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks highly of his teacher, showing his respects for her knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail in respects to the cat's impressive hunting skills.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood tall, earning the respects of all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece was a true masterpiece, deserving the respects of art enthusiasts everywhere.

meanings.definition: In some respects; in some ways.
meanings.sent1: She was happy with the results, but in respects, she wished for more improvement.
meanings.sent2: The project was successful in respects, but it could have been better planned.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious, but in respects, it lacked the perfect amount of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The movie was entertaining, but in respects, it fell short of being a blockbuster hit.
meanings.sent5: The new technology was impressive, but in respects, it still had room for enhancement.
